Reviews.Title: “Great option for a stop-over”
Reviews.Author: MikeR825
Reviews.Content: So convenient with easy check-in for the exhausted traveller. Very comfortable with good space to get some work done if needed. The wide range of restaurants available in the terminal is a bonus. Expensive but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “All what you need, but charging too much”
Reviews.Author: Duracell_KSA
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the hotel for 6 hours. There is an option to stay in this hotel and pay per hour rate. However, the rate is quite expensive compared to overall rate and what you get. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable with all amenities you might require during a layover. Service is good but a bit too slow. i had to wait for 15 minutes at reception while only 4 people were waiting at reception while i arrived. Strangly how the evaluation forms are filled. I was just asked by the receptionist to write down my name on an empty satisfaction card - that's something VERY bad... Anyway, it seems to be the only option at Dubai Airport so if you want to relax for a bit - definitely you will get a nice sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “Pay by the hour”
Reviews.Author: Syrianoloukoumi
Reviews.Content: Incredibly convenient, as it is inside the terminal, and minutes away from many gates; for example, it was only 10 minutes walk to my gate. In addition, you only pay by the hour. I had 5 hours between flights, so I booked the hotel for 4. It would have been worth every penny, as the bed was very comfortable and the shower great. The only problem was that a pipe burst and the ceiling started dripping 1 hour before I was due to wake up; I was therefore deprived one hour's sleep, for which I was offered a 10% discount. I pointed out to them that since I lost 25% of my sleep the discount should have been 25%. In the end they accepted my argument, but not before putting up a fight, hence the 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely convenient hotel for stop-over's but expensive”
Reviews.Author: PauloRJ
Reviews.Content: Rooms are big and very comfortable. I stayed there 2 times - on my way from Brazil to Thailand and on my way back. Room service food is also very good. Price is high, but it is extremely convenient for people waiting connection flights. Hotel also has a pool and sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome option”
Reviews.Author: Sawnbay
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times. It's a VERY welcome haven to sleep between flights. A great night's sleep everytime. Room servce is very prompt. Why leave the airport. You do have to remember (plan for) that you won't have access to your checked luggaged when you stay here, however there's a convenience store in the terminal below which sells toiletries etc. Everything you could want is within reach. And when you check out, your leasurely walk to your boarding gate could be as little as 60 seconds from the hotel lift ! - It IS worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value”
Reviews.Author: Martin911186263
Reviews.Content: Be prepared. This is not of the standard for a four star hotel. The welcome was good and staff were friendly and polite. The room was light and pleasant but the carpets were stained. The bedding was soft and comfortable - ideal for transit passengers who just need a good shower and to get some quality sleep. We arrived at 03.00 and were not leaving until 16.00 on the same day. We woke for breakfast around 09.30 and were directed down the duty free mall to the Galerie Restaurant (linked to the Hotel). The staff here were rude and unhelpful. They refused to let us sit where we wished, directing us to a busy area near the cashdesk. They did not then set our table, we had to ask for cutlery, ask for coffee, find our own way around, ask for service when the chef left his post for 10 minutes and this cost us $88 for two. The food quality was poor. You would get better value at Starbucks, and maybe a smile too. Back at the hotel we wanted to go for a swim whilst we waited for the next flight. We had been warned by the attendant that the pool was very cold - it was really small and freezing. The jacuzzi had an 'out of order' notice on it and when I asked if I could use the sauna, they said we don't have one here but there's one in Terminal 1!! The Steam Room was not switched on. (Steam room and sauna are listed as part of the health club facilities at extra cost - but you can't actually have them here in Terminal 3). Basically if you know British Premier Inns, the hotel was about of this standard. Expect that and you won't be disappointed. The overall experience was not worth the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice For A Day”
Reviews.Author: Theyoung1
Reviews.Content: I had a 12-hour layover in Dubai, and needed a play to spend some time. Nice place to stay for a few hours, nothing too exciting though. Pros: Comfortable bed, nice shower once I figured it out, clean room with plenty of amenities such as water, coffee, toiletries and slippers and robe. Cons: The hot water never came on in the sink, so shaving was interesting. I was to receive a complimentary breakfast but the front desk said I was too late. They let me apply the credit for lunch, but I still had to pay for a beverage. The food was not to my individual liking- middle eastern cuisine, foods I cannot even pronounce. A cheeseburger and fries would have been nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to rest after a long flight”
Reviews.Author: chad s
Reviews.Content: We stayed at DIH on both occasions to/and from USA to ASIA. We were traveling with a toddler and a baby and this was a great place to rest, relax, and shower. On the trip from USA we were met at the gate and escorted to the hotel. This was a great help since we were all tired after a 14hr flight. Check-in was pretty smooth. At checkout, they even helped us with our bags to the gate since we had two kids with us. Rooms are very clean and they have all the amenities you need. All the toiletries, bath robes, slippers, water, tea, coffee is provided. Wake up calls are right on time. Price is a little expensive for 5 or 6 hour stay but totally worth it after a long flight. I would definitely recommend this after a long flight if you have about 5 hours or more.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay on a long stopover”
Reviews.Author: loveseeingtheworld79
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last month after flying out of Nairobi. Arrived at 11pm and the flight back to Brisbane didn't leave until 10:30 the next morning. Booked in advance, so paid a little less than just walking in. It is expensive for the time you spend there, but totally worth the money to get away from the crowds and to sleep. Cool, quiet rooms with top amenities. Fruit tray on the table. Wake up call exactly when you say! No problems checking in or out. Noone was there to meet me as stated in other reviews, but no problems in finding it. Checked luggage goes all the way, so you only have carry on. But bathroom is well stocked with most things (shaving items, toothbrush/paste etc). Would definitely recommend a stay here if you have a lengthy stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facility For Long Haul Travel!”
Reviews.Author: anthonyv1
Reviews.Content: We planned a 10 hour connection delay at Dubai, so we could sleep, shower and change in the hotel in Terminal 3. We were hoping it would be similar to other hotels in Dubai, in that they all offer very spacious rooms and luxury to one degree or another. This hotel does exactly that. There was a super king size bed, lounge and large bath and shower room, plus refreshments and mini bar in a standard room. My wife, 2 and 4 year old children and I were completely refreshed and ready for our 18 hour trek to Auckland, and the children had been able to run around a bit and play, before once again being confined in the aeroplane. I would recommend this hotel for anyone having a long flight from Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “A definate must”
Reviews.Author: lyndabeckwith
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Australia having spent 8 weeks there. On our outward journey we stayed ovenight at The Dubai international Hotel and we were not sorry we did so. We were met at arrivals by a porter from the hotel and very quickly taken through security and up in the lift to reception where we were dealt with quickly and efficiently. The porter took us to our Delux room which was beautiful with a king size bed and everything you need for an overnight stay even down to the slippers. A platter of fruit on the table, bottles of water, tea and coffee all complimentary.The bathroom was superb. We had a wake up call which was spot on time. I would certainly recommend this hotel for anyone having to spend a few hours in between flights. I had read other reports saying how expensive it was but we thought it was value for money for the 8 hours we spent there.

Reviews.Title: “Massive room with a price !”
Reviews.Author: traveldizzy
Reviews.Content: Booking this hotel was a greate decision for the 16 hours stopover in Dubai after our holiday. We had the exceutive (don't know the exact name) massive room with all things you would need and a massage chair too. Oh yes and a 50 Dirham credit you could spend. They just want to spoil you ! :) After a couple of hours in Dubai city and duty free we hit the bed for a good night rest. Although it was very expensive for the time but it worthwhile of every penny spent.This hotel is above the gates and convenient as you don't have go through the security, immigration and all the airport madness. Now that does not give you a reason for your plane and the 300 passengers waiting for you ! :) Make sure you have plenty of time for boarding, just in case... Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good pit stop on the way to South Asia”
Reviews.Author: AnKTravelers
Reviews.Content: Stayed one evening on the way to Bangladesh. Clean room, quiet and dark. Just what our family of four needed after the long flight from the U.S. The hotel provided a baby crib but it wasn't the safest or most baby proofed crib but it was a nice touch. Connecting rooms were also really helpful, fresh fruit and water nice too. Our only complaint: we asked for a meet and greet at our gate to help us navigate security and find the hotel. nNoone from the hotel was there and there were no signs how to find the hotel until the terminal. we finally found the hotel and then waited in a long long line to check in only t be told that our roons were interminal three. We had to walk with a newborn baby and a screaming toddler for more than 20 minutes to the terminal three and thenit took another 20 minutes to get us checked in. Unacceptable. The hotel could have communicated to us by email the location of our rooms and thenperhaps provided a little golf cart style cart t get us to the room. We were totally exhausted and it was rather awful to have to lug everything so far without more help. All said though I would stay there again if I had to do the trip over.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice" for a mom travel with 2 boys (4&6 Yr) - Staff are very friendly and kind to help.”
Reviews.Author: Retha S
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my 2 boys rather than waiting in the airport for 5,5 hours my husband suggest that we book a room in the airport. Room is nice & clean, glad that I can refresh my self at nice shower & clean bathroom, the amenities is good the air con a bit loud. My boys are very happy with the food that we ordered from room service, tasty, quick delivered & price is good. I would highly recommended the hotel for family since Dubai airport is big and crowded it is nice for the children & I to have a privacy before another long flight. The staff pick us up as soon as we get out from the bus bring us to the hotel and help us to chek in & check out accompany us until the gate (excellent service). In less than 3 weeks I will fly with my mom via Dubai to Europe again looking forward to have a nice rest at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stopover for 5 hours”
Reviews.Author: AMac002
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was reasonable. Very dissapointed that the room I booked for 5 hours (booked direct by email to hotel) would have been cheaper if I had booked for 6 hours. Rooms was fine. Not sure If I should stay here or somewhere else on my return trip in July now.

Reviews.Title: “Treat yourself to a comfortable transit in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: LaohuPenang
Reviews.Content: If you want to splash out some money resting between flights at Dubai airport, this is a must. You do not need to go through passport control. Enjoy four star facilities, a personal welcome and an excellent buffet at the The Gallery restaurant and arrive at your next flight well rested and in a good physical condition!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Transit Hotel -- Less Jet Lag and Hassle”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Terminal 1 portion of this hotel -- located in the center of the terminal above the food court and the Duty Free shopping area. I was in transit and arrived at approximately 8 pm with a 7 am flight the next day. This was perfect for me - and really reduced my jet lag issues. The hotel was beautiful, comfortable and had everything I needed. I also ordered room service - it was tasty, not expensive, and quickly delivered to my room. I highly recommend you stay at this hotel and avoid passport control if you have flight times similar to my situation. I booked through Expedia and had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but slow service”
Reviews.Author: aumbricht
Reviews.Content: Very easy and convenient to access. Rooms are practical and very good bed to rest for a few hours. Reception was slow and reception area was messy with a guy threatening to commit suicide. Management should have strict policies and procedures to handle such people. In particular at 3 AM. When you make a booking get it in writing and keep a copy. the rates they quote and then charge were different.

Reviews.Title: “Just not that good”
Reviews.Author: finca_escastell
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel on both legs of a trip Madrid to Kenya. On teh outward leg checking in we found the reservation had been truncated from 2 adults plus two kids to just two adults, so were were presented with a room with just two single beds. We were promsed an extra bed by reception and again by the porter but after waiting an hour we got nothing and were too tired to wait more. On the return the travel agent took at least 24 hours to get a response back from teh hotel re beds- this time we got a queen & ONE extar bed, we asked for more sheets & duvet so I coudl sleep on teh couch but again despite promises nothing came. Room was OK, albeit completely devoid of character, and the combination of these things with a few other minor quibbles (wetroom bathroom which flooded every time we used teh shower as noone had cleaned the drains out, a minibar which kept on locking itself and a porter who didnt understand that 4 year old kids cant match Usain Bolt for pace after coming off an 8 hour flight mean that this place just is not good enough for the prices. We were also told NOT to order from room service as it would take too long so we were forced back into the odious tabernacle of capitalist and greed which is Dubai Airport Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel experience after a tiring flight.”
Reviews.Author: R_A_Siddiqui
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a couple, as soon as we got of the plane we are recieved by a hotel employee on the gate, he got us through security and we were in our room in 5 mins. We had a stay over of 17 hours to next flight. The room was very comfy and the bathroom was brilliant as well. Room service was available and food was really good. This was my best hotel experience so far. I highly recommend it and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable room in a posh shopping mall …”
Reviews.Author: felipeordonez
Reviews.Content: The Dubai International Hotel is a permutation on the Tom Hanks movie, "The Terminal", in that it is located inside the vast international airport terminal in Dubai. With the dramatic increase in Dubai's status as an international hub for long-haul flights, not only for Emirates Airlines, so there hotel fills a niche need to provide for transit accommodation for weary travellers between flights or, as it was for me, a way to break a long journey, e.g. Europe to Australia. The advantage is that as a stopover guest, you don't have to go through Dubai customs and immigration, nor collect your luggage. You are met at the gate on your arrival and are conducted to the hotel reception – you only need to send the hotel an email in advance advising it of your flight – where check-in is quick, and pretty soon you are in a spacious, comfortable, albeit minimalist, room inside the terminal. It's a little bizarre, as when you draw back the curtains you can be face-to-face with a Boeing 777 or Airbus A340. The hotel has a bar and 24-hour room service, a swimming pool, fitness centre and offers free wi-fi. The usual bathroom "amenities" are provided, so you only need to bring with you your hand luggage containing perhaps pyjamas and a change of underwear. Because it is located inside the terminal, the hotel opens into a vast duty-free shopping mall – one of the lifts is conveniently located opposite the premium spirits section! – where there are all manner of shops and restaurants, ranging from Burger King and McD's to some seriously fine dining venues, coffee shops, supermarkets, the usual souvenir tat shops, as well as eye-wateringly expensive designer clothes, jewellery and luxury goods such as you would expect in Dubai. When the time comes for your onward flight, it is but a 5 or 10 minute stroll to the boarding gate; no baggage check-in, no security lines. Couldn't be easier. Just remember you won't have your checked-in luggage with you in the hotel, so pack your hand luggage accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for stopover not leaving airport”
Reviews.Author: Kasparainens
Reviews.Content: Meet and greet service was very helpful, hotel, while expensive, provided all the needed to have good rest between the flights. Rooms large. Better than Emirates lounge if you can afford it :)

Reviews.Title: “It's a nightmare to find!”
Reviews.Author: barneygeorge
Reviews.Content: Unlike other reviewers, we didn't know about or book the meet and greet service and live to regret it because finding the hotel and knowing what 'barriers' you're not allowed to cross is a dreadful experience, especially in the early hours of the morning after a long flight. From the minute we set foot off the plane, we looked for signs directing us to the Dubai International Hotel because we knew it was in the terminal building but couldn't find any. So we proceeded to Baggage Claim and Passport control and still no signs. At this point we had to ask assistance only to be told that we shouldn't have 'left' the airport and wouldn't be allowed back through to the hotel!! We were instructed to check-in our suitcases for the flight the following afternoon ... hastily extracting clean underwear from the cases... we couldn't have our toilet bag of course. And then Security had to scan our boarding cards before they would let us through again to Departures - his machine wouldn't let us - he told us to see a Supervisor - she had to check we had a confirmed booking at the hotel - permission to go back through Security much to the guard's annoyance - back through Passport Control - and into Departures. But still no signs apart from one saying 'Hotel East' or 'Hotel West' ... how did we know it was the same hotel and how did we know whether we wanted East or West?? (they were in opposite directions!!) The Information Desk staff member gruffly replied 'that way' and pointed to a lift. Out of the lift and a long walk to Reception (which was also badly signposted) and we eventually got a room key. The room was a box with a dirty yellow carpet. The bed was comfortable enough but only one poor quality pillow each; it was 4 in the morning so I couldn't be bothered ringing Reception to ask for more pillows - we just wanted to sleep. I wasn't impressed and nor was my husband who needed to work for an hour and was unable to get internet connection. The one redeeming factor was that we did have 2 bottles of drinking water; a tea tray and a bathroom with a decent shower and an very extensive range of toiletries. At least that enabled us to freshen up properly before our last long flight. In all honesty, can't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The only way to relax between flights.”
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: We generally stay each year as a break between flights from Bahrain to Europe or Australia. The hotel is convenient, rooms are spacious and complimentary fruit, tea/coffee and large range of toiletries appreciated. We have found the staff vary in efficiency but are always friendly. The meet and greet service is excellent and saves so much time waiting at passport control. Although expensive it does enable you to recharge for the next leg of your trip. This year will be the 45th time we have passed through Dubai Airport and , as a matter of course, will be using the hotel again for two forthcoming European trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: milotales
Reviews.Content: Using this facility meant arriving at destination nice and fresh. The room was very nice - decorated in lively and fresh colours and comfortable bed. Wifi almost impossible to use which was a big down side - staff kept insisting it worked but from own experience only if you sat in the lobby and that was even patchy too. Finding the entrance to the hotel wasnt extremely clear and was getting different advice from different people of how to find the entrance. But it was nice to go for a stroll and duty free shopping with ease after check in. Would stay again if had a long stop over as it takes the edge off the trip plus the convenience of not having to leave the airport to get to a hotel.... hopefully the Wifi will get fixed?!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good rooms, but inexplicably hard to find and wifi patchy”
Reviews.Author: AandM2008
Reviews.Content: We had an 8 hour layover at Dubai International Airport terminal 3 and wanted some rest. Good points: 1) The rooms are quiet and well appointed, with comfortable beds, and they very helpfully provide you with little toothbrush, a shaving kit etc... in the bathroom. The staff are friendly and will tell you your gate when you check out. 2) The location is very convenient for departure gates in terminal 3, you are essentially right next to the gates (although the airport is quite large, so factor walking time in if you want to cut it close to catch a few extra minutes of zzz's). Less good points: 1) The signposting to the hotel is inexplicably poor. It turns out you need to go up and through a hand-baggage security check point, and then take a lift up to the 5th floor. You arrive on a very long (and in our case deserted) corridor. After some exploration we discovered that the hotel layout is basically a very long hallway, capped at each end by an East and a West check-in desk. If you book in advance, it turns out you can only check in at one of the two desks. We eventually found the West one, but were then walked back to the East one for check in. It took us quite some time to find the hotel; we asked 4 or 5 airport employees along the way, but even their directions were consistently vague. 2) The wifi was very patchy -- in our rooms it didn't work, although it worked in the lobby area. That is quite problematic if you are on business and have a few urgent things to attend to. Given the price-point of the rooms, it is unclear why this couldn't be sorted out.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: globalfun00
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in close proximity to our gate for our departing flight. That was a huge plus. The shower handle in the room was a bit confusing to work. Overall, it was a clean comfy room suitable for a few hours stay in between flights.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a long layover”
Reviews.Author: Charlie3Zero
Reviews.Content: Fast hassle free check-in and check-out, free wifi but oh so slow.... voip was unusable for example. Clean well appointed rooms with a well equipped shower and the suite area had some comfy armchairs and a very nice desk for working on. we did not try the breakfast as our flight was very early. We especially liked that the hotel sent a member of staff to the arrival gate to collect us and assist in the usual trials of navigating Dubai's excessive airport security.

Reviews.Title: “A MUST for long transits in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: KathyHatz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when returning from Greece with our 1 year old baby. Easy to find, very clean clean and comfortable hotel right inside the terminal which made our long transit in Dubai not only bearable but pretty much the only nice thing about travelling with a baby long haul!! HIGHLY recommend using this facility!!

Reviews.Title: “A Rip-off”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Rohan
Reviews.Content: Two days ago, I paid 240 USD (880 Dirham, pre booked, special offer) for a standard room from midnight to 9 am during a transit in Dubai Airport. A pickup service at the gate was arranged but nobody was there to pick me up! If you are not familiar with the Dubai airport it’s not easy to find this long belt like hotel which is located in the 5th and 6th floor of the Terminal 3. There are no clear sign boards or instructions. The elevator entrance is easily missed in this crowded place. Compared to any other refuted airport terminal hotels, this hotel is a rip-off. There is no service and the prices are ridiculous. The room rate varies depending on the time of the check-in and out and how and when you book, roughly about 60 USD/hour. Just to compare the prices, Ambassador Transit Hotel in Singapore airport charges only 52 USD for 6 hours! After going up and down several times, finally I managed to find the front desks of the hotel. There are 2 front desks: East and West. If you have a pre-booked room, you need to find the right reception first. Room was spacious and clean. Free internet was not working in the night, surprisingly in the morning Wi-Fi was working near the gate and even inside the plane. Water flow of the over head shower was almost zero! A/C was noisy. The safety deposit box was permanently closed! This is the one and only hotel inside the terminal which needs no immigration clearance at Dubai airport hotel. So the passengers have no other option but to pay the ridiculous prices and get frustrated if your expectations are not met. Holyday Inn and Le Meridian hotels are just outside the airport and offer very reasonable rates, at least 50% cheaper. However it’s not very convenient since you need to clear immigration to get there~

Reviews.Title: “You're paying for the convenience”
Reviews.Author: D M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times on my way through DXB. I like two things about this hotel: 1) being greeted upon disembarkation and escorted to the hotel; and 2) its convenience. The rooms are nice enough, but nothing special. Carpet throughout the halls and rooms are shabby and occasional stains dot the landscape. Rooms are clean enough, but it is hard to not overlook the fact that people are just moving in and out of the room at a rapid pace - cleaners seems to be just ahead of the rotation. The reception staff are a bit rude and unfriendly (maybe because I usually arrive in the middle of the night). Overall, if you want to drop apx US$50 an hour for the convenience, then sure, why not?

Reviews.Title: “Mmmm sleep”
Reviews.Author: Nomadsjandp
Reviews.Content: We stopped here on out trips between Italy &Australia 4 times out of 6 and would reccomend it because: 1. You don't have to spend over an hour exciting the airport through customs -my God they were sooo slow. 2. You are in bed within 30 minutes of landing. 3. Clean, quiet, lots of hot water in the shower 4. The spa is just along the corridor and does great massages :-)

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a godsend for long layovers at DXB!”
Reviews.Author: TORN1
Reviews.Content: Transiting through DXB at night on a flight from Cairo to Toronto and had a 10 hour layover. We knew we wanted to get a hotel but being Canadian we would have had to prearrange and pay for another 96 hour visa prior to arrival if we had to leave the airport so very thankful we found out about this hotel inside the terminal! A hotel employee met us at our gate and walked us to the lobby of the hotel in the east wing of the terminal. Very thankful for this meeting as it would have taken a lot longer to have found the hotel on our own. Our bags were checked all the way from Cairo to Toronto so no dilly dallying trying to pick up your luggage. Be prepared for this and pack your carry-on carefully so you have any items you might need while in transit ie - meds, converters, chargers, bathing suit. Don't worry too much about toiletries as the hotel had mini shavers, toothbrush/paste, mouth wash, aftershave, soap, shampoo, conditioner and lotions. Not the best quality and in shody containers but available none the less in the bathroom at no cost! Very clean hotel and room with excellent bed and bedding. Bright decor but with the lights off and our intent was to sleep so not a true bother. My only beef(s) with this hotel, being inside an International airport I would have preferred more plug outlet options for recharging electronics and my friends CPAP machine. We had forgotten to pack the converter, our fault not the hotels, but would have thought an electrical outlet would have been available. Also, the pool was closed and the gym and sauna facilities were at the DIH in the other terminal. I had been looking forward to some added relaxation but that was all too far away from the location we were in. A little pricy but we were well rested and refreshed to continue our journey home! Worth every penny for this convenient location and 8 hour sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Anton G
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night there. Hotel should be 3 or 4 stars, and it is what you should expect - Hotel airport where you wait for next flight. You are not going choose this hotel when having vacation in Dubai, aren't you? For the purpose it is suggested it is perfect. You will be met by a polite Gentlemen helding a paper with your name, he will take you to a hotel room. there are flowers and fruits everywhere. Bed is very comfortable, but there isn't any view from the room window. Bathroom is nice, many bath items will be issued to you becauce probably your luggage won't be with you in this hotel (be ready to it and take everything you need for the night). I wouldn't say it is noisy, yes, it is an airport, what you think? But come on! What you need after a tiresome flight? A good bathroom and comfortable bed. You will find both in any of these rooms. Breakfast was also nice, they brought it in my room and it cost be about 50 Dirhams. If you need a 1 night hotel before next flight - this place is your best option.

Reviews.Title: “Dubai International Hotel Terminal 3 - Great for stopover”
Reviews.Author: Pamies
Reviews.Content: We decided to break our trip from Europe to Australia with a stopover in the airport terminal 3 hotel. We were met at our arrival gate by a hotel employee who showed us through the terminal to the hotel. Our room was huge with funky modern decoration. It was nicely furnished, air-conditioned, large LCD TV, tea and coffee making facilities, fridge and minibar, full set of toiletries including shaver, tooth brushes, paste and mouth wash, dressing gowns and complimentary water and a fruit bowl (apple, banana and grapes), The bathroom was also large with a big shower cubical, It was surprising quiet and the bed was really comfortable although the pillows a little soft. Free Wi Fi is also available. The room was very clean and the bathroom, although no mould the white grout was a bit grubby. We had our luggage checked through to Australia and packed an overnight bag. The convenience of not having to go through security and immigration was great, we just walked straight up to the departure gate and saved heaps of time. One tip is that they have an electronic minibar within the refrigerator that they electronically lock the night before your departure. We had medication that required refrigeration so when I explained this to them they left the door unlocked. Would definitely stay here again for a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Its worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Family_travellers07
Reviews.Content: We only had a 9 hours between flights. Our flight arrive late and we were met at the arrival gate and whisked through security and straight too the hotel reception. Quickly went through registration and shown to our room - all within 20 minutes of arriving at the airport. They had the departure time of our flight and arranged a wake-up call giving us ample time to get to the departure gate. We managed to get nearly 7 hours sleep. Had we gone into a hotel outside of the hotel the price was the same and we would have been lucky to have got 4 hours sleep by the time we had got through immigration and transported to the hotel and back to the airport. We would certainly pay the money and do it again.

Reviews.Title: “it's worth it, when you have hours between flights, but a/c is too noisy”
Reviews.Author: meisdmtr
Reviews.Content: we had 10 hours betWeen flights. when we landed, hotel staff met us and walked to the hotel. the room is great, apart from the fact that a/c is too noisy, and when it turned on at night it woke me up several times. for the money it costs, i would expect it to not happen. but overall experience is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor location and overpriced!!!”
Reviews.Author: REBurwell
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel by my husband's company because we flew into Abu Dhabi at 23:45 and were due to be picked up by a driver to go to Abu Dhabi at 0630. Someone met us right off the plane and then we ran after him through the terminal with our very tired 3 year old daughter in tow. He was pleasant but informed us that we were not able to get our baggage that night as the hotel was entirely THIS SIDE of security and you cant' got out and re-enter without a valid ticket. I was under the impression that part of the hotel was outside in the terminal but apparently not because we asked and no one seemed to have an actual answer for us!!! We were trying to be patient but at this point we didn't have any toiletries, fresh clothes or overnight pull ups for our daughter. What frustrated me the most was the very vague, unhelpful answers we kept getting. My husband and daughter fell asleep quickly but the light coming in through around the curtains was distracting to me. I will say however that the bed was very comfortable and the room was modern and clean, also the amenities were good. The customer service needs some work though and at the price they charge this hotel is NOT worth it in my opinion. I just wanted to let others know the location of the hotel in case they think they are staying in an airport hotel........that this is NOT the case!!!!!!! this is more like a very fancy layover spot. In the morning thankfully we found an employee who was switched on and who pointed us off in the direction of security, and told us WHERE to actually get our bags from the night before!! He actually ended up chasing us down to escort us the wrong way through security, who had just told us to go back up the stairs and ask someone at information!!!! What a colourful start to the trip :)

Reviews.Title: “Very good but very expensive!!”
Reviews.Author: MemberfromPadova
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 4:00 AM at DXB after a nine-hour flight, and had a twelve hours layover between connections: the hotel was the only option available to catch some sleep. At 260 Euro per room per night (same price for single or double) I really felt I had been ripped off. But in the end I was not disappointed for the room was excellent. The bed was one of the most comfortable I had ever experienced, the bathroom was very large and with all necessary toiletries, there was even a massage chair! I slept very well, and when I woke up after six hours I had rested perfectly. I tried continental breakfast which, surprisingly, was reasonably priced if compared to the hotel standard. In the end, I wound up spending a lot of money but I got what I wanted. I think I will probably consider this option again should the necessity occur.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if free, to expensive otherwise.”
Reviews.Author: arrahman74
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice. +ve: it is within the airport area so no need to get thru customs / passport control. If your stay is short (4 - 6) hours, this is good for a quick nap. -ve: Too expensive. Rooms not soundproof so sleep quality is low. Service is not very good (i requested to keep my luggage for 2-3 hours when I was checking out but they refused. i requested to extend my check out time by 2 hours, as i had arrived late in night, but the receptionist told that she is not authorized to do this). If you are staying for longer time + 12 hours, its better to find a hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice way to prepare for your next trip”
Reviews.Author: MartinKonicek
Reviews.Content: Arriving from Male, we had almost seven hours of waiting time for put connecting flight. Last time we stayed in the Emirates business Lounge, which is OK, but you won't get your rest there. This time we stayed for couple of hours in the Dubai International hotel, which is on the fifth floor in Terminal 3. We were picked-up on the arrival gate by one of the hotel employees, guiding us fast to the hotel. Nice clean room, comfortable bed. The only thing is that the room is not soundproof, so you can hear the flight announcments. But still much better, than the lounges. Paid around 200 USD, which is quite a lot of money for six hour stay, but it was absolutelly worth the money. On the next stop in Dubai we will certainly stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: RJDemp
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel on three occasions when transiting through Dubai. On each occasion, I've found it to be very comfortable, clean and quiet. The rooms are very nicely decorated in bright colours, the beds are comfortable, and the service is great. If you let them know your flight in advance, they will meet you at your gate, although it's easy to find the hotel on your own. The room is a fair size and more than adequate for a transit stay. It's also nice to have free wifi in the room. Short stays are very expensive though, it costs almost as much for a few hours as it does for a whole day.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay and have a break”
Reviews.Author: Dezign99
Reviews.Content: I have transited at Dubai a number of times. On occassion I decide notto venture into Dubai but rather remain at the airport until my next flight. I had 17 hours between flights and decided it will be worthwhile checking into the transit hotel this time round. The experience was great overall. The decor was unusaual and shocking at first but I soon became accustomed to the bright colours. Check-in was fairly prompt. The room was extremely quiet and the only noise was from the airconditioning. The room was neat and tidy with only a few marks visible on the bright carpet. The bathroom was well-equipped with sopas, shower caps, dental kit and so on. TIn the room there was an iron and ironing board as well as a knitting kit. There were beverage (coffee and tea) facilities in the room which I enjoyed. The is a fully stocked mini-bar in the room but you have to pay 300 dirham as a deposit. I did not make use of this facility as I only wanted a coke and did not feel like going through all the credit card exercise just for that. My experience (at various establishments) has been bad when establishments put a hold on your card. You battle to get your funds released and credited later. The downside. I was first shown to a smoiking room but only realised when I got there. I told there staff that I preferred a non-smoking room. While the 2 staff members were not rude they definitely seemed irritated by my request. They quickly assisted me though. Unlike the experience of guests from other reviews, there was no one (from the hotel) to pick me up at the plane and walk me to the hotel. Possibly because the arrival was late, not sure? I did not really battle to locate the hotel in terminal 3 though. Finally, while the rest at the hotel was welcome and worth it, the point has to be made that it is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but then your choice is limited at the airport”
Reviews.Author: ExiledNorthamptonian
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly functional hotel. The rooms are quite big (bigger than the rooms at the terminal hotels in Singapore airport), but the room rates are a bit high (130Eur) for a 7 - 8 hour stay. There is complementary Tea and Coffee, and a small fruit ball. The rooms are quiet and comfortable, and have natural light, if required. Worth it to unwind between stopovers, but for, say, a trip from west to east, and the option was singapore or dubai, I'd rather stay at the Singapore airport than at the Dubai airport. The Singapore airport is a better stopver experience.

Reviews.Title: “Airport bliss.....”
Reviews.Author: HoutBayDiver
Reviews.Content: We had a 9 hour stopover in Dubai from Cape Town to Istanbul 1.20am to 10.30 am. Altough I travel on a medium range budget, I decided book a room here and it was an excellent decision. In fact I felt like I "saved" myself some precious holiday time by arriving fresh and cheery utilising the first afternoon and evening in Istanbul to the full. Had I decided to book into any other Dubai hotel, the visas alone, as South Africans for the two of us, would nearly have equalled the cost of this hotel. I booked and paid for 6 hours (2am - 8pm) directly on the hotel website. On check in the friendly staff at reception told us that we were welcome to stay till our fight departure (no extra cost). As reported by other reviewers, we were met on arrival and escorted to our spacious hotel room on level 5 (terminal 3). Check in just took a minute and thereafter we felll into the very comfy bed and slept like logs, did not hear a squeak from anywhere. The decor is quite loud and brave, but somehow soothing, pleasant and refreshing at the same time. The only critisism is the unsightly stains on the carpet, something also mentioned by earlier reviewer (perhaps we had the same room!) For the rest the room looked like brand new and finishings and linen were all of high qualiry as expected from a hotel of this class and tariff. For early breakfast snack we devoured the thoughtful fruit basket welcome gift. The "tea tray" supplied all you needed for your tea/coffee and the bathroom is equipment with all those needs as well, even down to shaver and comb, also two fluffy white dressing gowns and slippers. The bathroom has a bidet and shower (no bath). We were allowed 30 minutes free internet in the "business center" at the level of reception but had to sign a slip for usage. We had to ask around a bit to find the centre as the door leading to it is not sign posted but that was just a simple matter of asking. On checkout the receptionist informed us of our departure gate. All in all the hotel was all we expected and we enjoyed our sleepover!

Reviews.Title: “Air-side hotel is a brilliant idea”
Reviews.Author: maxandspot
Reviews.Content: Cost/major benefit: If you like to stop and sleep horizontally while on long haul travel like we do, this hotel is a good option. It is pay (in advance) by the hour. We travelled with teenage children and two interconnecting rooms cost 1,430 Dirhams including tax for 20 hours. We found our Australian dollars went nearly twice as far as they did for airport hotels in Asia, not to mention the speediness involved in completely skipping immigration processing. Arrival Being airside had real advantages; we were met off the plane and taken by staff to the front of the queue to have our hand luggage screened - a real time saver. It's certainly the quickest way into a bed, which incidentally is extraordinarily comfortable and has great pillows. They require your passport at hotel check-in and we did have one issue at this point; the hotel had doubled our booking i.e. 4 rooms instead of 2, but as I had only paid for two I wasn't too concerned. Room Plusses: Modern decor, effective air conditioning and comfortable bedding. As you do not have access to checked-in baggage in this airside hotel, the bathroom amenities are particularly useful and include toothbrush / paste (like the ones you get in-flight) and mouthwash. Although the air con is not noisy per se, I find I need to sleep with air plugs when there's in-room air con. However I could not hear any noise from the terminal. My husband thought he vaguely heard a daytime call to prayers but I had to strain to pick this up. In short, our room on level 5 of Terminal 3 was quiet and had good curtains. Minuses: None really. The loud carpet is not to my personal taste and its light colour seems a silly choice in terms of showing disconcerting stains. I wore the disposable slippers provided anyway, but I am sure it is no 'dirtier' than any other hotel carpet. Room service Once we realised how to use the phone (we were reading Terminal 1's phone numbers by mistake) we found room service to be a good option. The food arrived in 35 minutes as they said it would and 3 American-portioned meals cost us about $53 Australian. Room service takes credit cards, so not having any Dirhams in cash wasn't problematic. When paying this way it also tells you the cost in your own currency. We normally never order room service anywhere due to cost but this was not expensive and allowed those who were hungry to sleep while our daughter continued to sleep on in the other room. Gym The Health Club in the Terminal 3 hotel is smallish but reasonably well equipped. There is a treadmill, stationary bike, stepping and elliptical machine in addition to weights and quad press etc. It seemed clean and pleasant enough although I don't think the stepping machine was working properly. Good for a bit of in-transit exercise anyhow. I was a bit alarmed when the attendant asked me to sign a slip which had 90 Dirhams on it, as he assured me my daughter and I could use the facilities free of charge. There was nothing to pay when we checked out though and nothing appeared on my credit card so I have no idea what that was all about.

Reviews.Title: “everything as promised”
Reviews.Author: utya
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an overnight stop en route from Perth to Frankfurt. We had about 16 hours which did not warrant entering and leaving the country, taxi fares etc., particularly after an early flight both mornings. As promised we were met on arrival and escorted to the hotel foyer (which was as well as it is a very large terminal). Check in was fast and efficient. The room was up to the standard with a very comfortable bed, large bathroom, robes, slippers, toothpaste, shaving, shampoo and all thngs needed for staying without ones luggage. The room was VERY quiet and air conditioning worked just fine. The only thing missing was decaff coffee but we did not bother to ask for it. We did not eat there, preferring the choice of options in the terminal. Check out was quick and we left with the knowledge that we would stay again under these circumstances. A good choice if you wish to break your journey.

Reviews.Title: “Just relax between flights and hang the high cost”
Reviews.Author: Gemfish
Reviews.Content: With only a seven hour layover in flights between Istanbul and Sydney, rather than slum out the time just hanging uncomfortably overnight in a departure lounge at Dubai Airport, we booked a room to sleep for five hours directly with this hotel located in the airport. Yes, it was expensive at around A$200 for the five hours but it was well worth it. Our bags were booked all the way through to Sydney and as we were only in transit, only our carryon luggage was available. These days of course this cannot include much in the way of toiletries. Never fear however as the hotel provides basic toiletries for use. Although our flight into Dubai was delayed, we were met on entering the terminal by a hotel representative who quickly took charge of our hand luggage and whisked us off to the hotel where we were very quickly booked in and escorted to our room. At check in we also settled the bill which allowed just that extra few minutes of sleep. The room was very large, modern and the big bed a welcome sight into which we sank to slumber until the requested wakeup call came through. We arrived at the departure gate ready for the next fifteen hours of flight rested and refreshed which is more than I can say for some of the other travellers on our flight. Money well spent and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stopover without hassle”
Reviews.Author: diverdoc
Reviews.Content: En route from Indonesia to UK I had an 18 hour stopover and this hotel was perfect for me. No hassle of entering/exiting Dubai, comfortable room and efficient staff. I was in Terminal 3 as flying Emirates. There is only a gym in the Terminal 3 hotel but you can walk to the Terminal 1 hotel and have free use of the facilities there. I really enjoyed a spell in their excellent steam room, helping the relaxation. Having booked online far ahead, I got a decent rate and was met at the gate and transferred through a quiet security point and checked in in no time. The hotel is located just above the business class lounge, so if you are flying in business class you caneasily get food and drink before retiring to your room. I would definitely use this hotel again - breaking the journey makes the long distance flying much less tiring.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bandaUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel on our way home from the Maldives. Our flight from the Maldives arrived at Dubai on the Thursday afternoon and our flight back to the UK was not until Friday morning so we thought this was the best option. We booked direct with the hotel months in advance which was probably the cheapest option. We were not disappointed! We were collected by a member staff on arrival at Dubai, fast tracked through security and taken straight to our hotel room. The room itself was very comfortable and quiet, you would not believe you were in the middle of an airport! The hotel supply you with 2 bottles of water and all the toiletries you need for free. There are plenty of restaurants, bars & shops within the airport to keep you busy. There was also a TV in the room and free WiFi. Would definitely stay again if I had a long wait between flights.

Reviews.Title: “Dubai International Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobDubai
Reviews.Content: If you have a long transit then I can definitely recommend this hotel. The dubai airport hotel staff are friendly and very helpful and check in and out was speedy. The hotel room was very comfortable. I stayed in a single deluxe and found it to be very well appointed. Bathrobes, slippers, products and comfy pillows. A great way to relax. Free water and a complimentary plate of fruit was also available. I found lots of useful information and made my booking on http://www.dubaiairportguide.com/dubai-airport-hotels/

Reviews.Title: “Dubai Airport hotel review”
Reviews.Author: manidevs
Reviews.Content: Its an exotic place to stay in. The comfort is awesome and the room maintenance was really good and was very clean. The had an excellent facility like wake up call according to your flight schedule. So you dont need to worry about catching up a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great for long transfers.”
Reviews.Author: gsalba
Reviews.Content: If you have more than five hours between flights this hotel is perfect. The meet and great when you come off the plane is also very good, especially if you don't know Dubai Airport. Having stayed in Dubai many times the quick tour that some people do holds no interest for me so this hotel is just the job. I've stayed here many times on my way from Thailand or Oz to Baku and it really breaks up the journey. Quiet as the grave and hassle free every time I've stayed here, either alone or accompanied.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: familytraveller5
Reviews.Content: I had a night to spend at Dubai Airport between flights and not wanting to sleep in the lounge I went up to the lobby of this hotel to see if there were any rooms. I did not make a booking but there were rooms available. The hotel is situated above the Emirates business lounge and one thing you notice about this place is that is is very quiet. Quite surprising since is above a large gathering of people. The room is outfitted with extras such as bathroom robes, shaving gear and iron, so it is all one would want for a transit hotel. The 6 hour stay cost US$200 or $300 for 24hrs which I think is quite reasonable for the only hotel in the terminal. They do have the monopoly so they can effectively charge anything they like, but this price is reasonable. Okay, it is not the Hilton, but it is very good for what it is and ticks the right boxes. The staff are very polite and efficient. I will return again should I have to stay for a few hours at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Best thing I did”
Reviews.Author: wobblywombats
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight between Perth and Geneva. It was very practical for me to stay there and it proved to be the best choice. For a start, the hotel concierge was at the end of the gangway with my name on a sign. He welcomed me to Dubai, took my hand luggage and very politely showed me the way. He navigate me through side doors and in no time we were in the lobby. The hotel was very clean, modern and efficient. Staff very professional and polite. The room was large, overlooking the departure lounge but we could not hear anything. Wonderful. The huge bed was very comfortable. The bathroom had anything you need for an overnight, including toothbrush and body cream. (Coconut milk and honey I think). It made my skin very soft. I recommend it! After refreshing, I went downstairs to walk the large shopping area and did some shopping in a/c comfort. In all the shops, I found the people to be pleasant and respectful. I bought take away dinner and back to the room to eat and read. The hotel offered free 1/2 hr internet in their business center. Enough to email the family that all was well. Reception offered a wake up call and without asking checked which gate my flight was leaving the next day. This hotel was not intrusive and made me feel very special and respected. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneSally
Reviews.Content: Stopped overnight to break the long flight from Rome to Melbourne. The reception staff were first class, the room spacious, comfortable and restful. There were soft lights in the room, a bowl of fresh fruit, tea and coffee making facilities, and a large bed, turned back, with beautiful linen. It was bliss not to have to go through Customs, and to be so close to the departure lounge the next morning, without all the hassles. However, you pay for the privilege! To me, it was money well spent and I would highly recommend it for the comfort and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “You wouldn't know you were in an airport”
Reviews.Author: A_St_Ranger421
Reviews.Content: There are two hotels on the airport, one in T1 and the other T3, both airside. I have stayed in both on a number of occasions, but I would say that theT1 hotel has the better rooms. However both room types are very spacious, quiet, very comfortable beds and pillows, bathroom (shower only) good quality fittings and all soaps,shampoos including toothpaste, combs, razor etc are provided. I would recommend carrying a change of shirt and underwear/socks as you will not be able to get access to your checked baggage. Slightly pricey, but book early on line and it is a lot cheaper. The first time I 'came in off the street' and paid £160+, but it comes down to circa £100 when booked online. Hoiwever, as I was on a business account the price wasn't a problem. If you fancy a drink , there is an Irish Village pub on the concourse - all drinks are VVVery expensive in the Emirates so don't blanch at the prices! If you book directly with the hotel online, a rep will meet you at the arrival gate and take you to the hotel. Once you get into your room you wouldn't know you were in an airport!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: SilvaYaro
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to see the hotel rooms inside the terminal. Very convenient for long trips. Bellboy waits for you at the gate and takes you to reception and help with check-in and settle in. They have a nice little business center you can use for e-mails, printing, skyping,... The rooms are very clean and surprisingly very quiet for a room inside the terminal. Overall, I loved it! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “3 hour stop over in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: LindaBrentwoodUK
Reviews.Content: We were flying into Dubai from Durban in South Africa and we desperately wanted a shower! We asked in reception at the Dubai International hotel - they were so very helpful. They directed us to their health club where private shower facilities are available. This includes a towelling robe, towels, all the toiletries you could possibly need - spotlessly clean. It costs US$ 14 per person but well worth every penny. I did not want to come out of the shower! There are also hair dryers available. It did help a lot as we had nearly 8 hours to face getting into Gatwick. You just come through arrivals, into departures and you will see a sign for the hotel - just get into the lift and head for reception.

Reviews.Title: “Good for quick stays. Can be troublesome for longer stays.”
Reviews.Author: daniegge
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Dubai International Hotel for the convenience. We had an 8-hour connection and decided to stay in the Airport. If it is your first time in Dubai ever and you get 8 hours or more to wait for you connection, do consider staying here. It is not too expensive, they charge for every six hours. For us it was a total of 160 dollars. To use the mini bar of the room they require an extra 300 AED (around 80 USD) which is totally not worth it since there are mini markets inside the airport in walking distance where you can buy sodas and water for 7 AED (less than 2 USD). Even a Starbucks right in front of the entrance. The restaurants around the airport are very cozy in the early hours of the morning and are open 24 hours. Food is great too and not expensive. We merely used to room to sleep for 3 hours and take a shower, other than that, there is a lot to do inside an airport and the variety of stores and things to see is very interesting. So it was a fun experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but still a high price tag”
Reviews.Author: rafatabedin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about 8 hours with my mom and dad. The rooms are nice, service is excellent, everything is good except for the price tag it came with. It cost about 230 USD for 8 hours for a normal deluxe room. Personally I think this is a bit too much.

Reviews.Title: “shocking treatment of old people”
Reviews.Author: inge44
Reviews.Content: An elderley couple arrived from Geneva at midnight with a written prepaid confirmation of funds paid in full for their stopover in Dubai before they continued their journey, and were denied access to their room by reception as they said the accommodation had not been prepaid. What is the world coming to when old people are left in transit for 10 hours because someone never did their job correctly ! ! ! Of course the check in personel now have no recollection of this incident at all and no one wants to take the blame. When I called earlier I asked to be transferred to a manager but got cut off in the process. I am a travel agent and I will never ever recommend any one to stay with this hotel again The staff pretend not to know what is going on. shocking ! ! !

Reviews.Title: “you pay a lot for the convenience”
Reviews.Author: barbucha
Reviews.Content: Very expensive hour hotel ( we were told that 140Euro is good deal for 6 hour stay,room only rate), but when you are exhausted and you don't have any other option that to pay or shop from midnight until 10am (not very suitable with tired 6month old) you take it. The hotel is located above the check in gates, with one way windows and provides great relax. Its furnished nicely in pleasant coloured scheme and you just wish you could stay longer in the big comfortable bed or have another hot shower. But when you look on the bill when you get home you don't understand why you have paid so much for a room which is not so special and it is not located in central Rome, Paris or Venice, but in the airport hall.

Reviews.Title: “A vague idea that ended up inspired”
Reviews.Author: CurlyandMe
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 hour stop-over in Dubai - not long by many standards - but we had been travelling economy class with Emirates from Australia and hoped to arrive in Europe in good condition. At approx $115 for the room, it wasn't cheap by any standards but we decided that compared to buying two meals, coffees, wandering around tired and aimless for that time and possibly buying things we could do without, it would be realistic value. We were met at the Emirates gate by a man with our names on a sign who personally whisked us up to the check-in desk where we had a prior booking. In no time at all we and our hand luggage were installed in a very cool, curtain darkened room with twin beds, luxurious doonas, coffee and tea making facilities and white robes and slippers. We had a lovely shower, a cup of tea, and slid under the doonas where we fell soundly asleep. Although we had set our own alarm, the reminder call from the front desk that we needed to head down to our next connecting flight was reassuring. When we looked out of the curtain we could look down into the departure lounge at all the people trying to sleep in chairs and pacing about. It was one of the most inspired decisions of a 6 week trip and would do it again whenever travelling through Dubai. And yes, we did arrive in Prague in good shape!

Reviews.Title: “Eeven better than the first time”
Reviews.Author: jslonisch
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dubai International during a layover last year and it worked so well that I planned the flight to specifically to include the layover this year. Advance purchase keeps the price down (although it is expensive) and ensures you're met as you get off the plane. The guy who did the escort obviously knew his way aroud and took me through a security scan that had no-one waiting so got to the hotel check-in very promptly. Within a very few minutes I was in the room. The room was better than I remembered from last time - some refurbishment has been going on and other than one or two marks on the carpet it was spotless. Had room service before bed and again at breakfast for less than 100 dirhams total which I though was not bad. For people who don't realise, this hotel is airside and you don't have access to your checked luggage - that's the whole point. But really you need no hand luggage other than a change of clothes - all toiletries, bathrobe and slippers are supplied. As I got on to my flight to Australia the next morning I felt a miilion times better than I would have if I had just transferred straight off the flight from Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: nakiboys
Reviews.Content: We had a 10 hour stopover in Dubai although with flight delays it was only 8 hours. We were meet off the airbridge from the Emirates flight and escorted through transit security and up to the hotel within 20 minutes of landing. The check-in was slightly chaotic but the room was well presented and it was lovely to have a sleep and shower before continuing on with the long flight to New Zealand. I would definitely stay here again if in transit.

Reviews.Title: “When you have that really long layover ...”
Reviews.Author: BLA07
Reviews.Content: This hotel, as you would expect, is high-priced for little luxury. However, when you have that really long layover in Dubai, and you don't want to go through the hassle of going through customs (visas, etc.), then it is really worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustineKaitaia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we had an overnight stopover in Dubai. The hotel was expensive but great - modern and clean. No wireless access in room, but there was a small lounge nearby that had it. It advertised a pool but the facilities were not yet open. There was a spa near the hotel which was nice. Note: if staying in this hotel you cannot collect your checked in baggage!

Reviews.Title: “Poor for the price”
Reviews.Author: Tommac58
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed here for one night during my transit back to UK. Firstly i could not get onto the internet in their business center as the service was not available, second some other room near me had their television full volume all night and finally there was no hot water available in the morning for a shower. So to charge £100 for just a bed is shocking. In future i will be making a reservation somewhere else !

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient.”
Reviews.Author: veedee57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dubai International Hotel between flights and it was so convenient. We were met at arrivals by a staff member (which we weren't expecting) who took us quickly through security then to the hotel reception and to our room, all very smoothly done. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable and a bowl of fruit was provided. Although it's located in the airport terminal we didn't hear any noise at all. Well worth the short stay for a good sleep and convenience of not having to leave the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep haven”
Reviews.Author: Teampower
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 hour stopover in Dubai from 10pm to 3am and organized a room to catch a few hours sleep. All this was done online before our holiday so I wasn't sure of where we were to go etc but was most impressed/relieved to find a hotel staff waiting to greet us on our arrival to Dubai who then took us to the hotel and organized everything. The service was very good! The rooms were lovely (we were just happy to have a bed!) and they made sure we had a wake up call and were very helpful overall. If you have a long stopover in Dubai or overnight I highly recommend staying here for peace of mind and a much needed rest (rather than wandering aimlessly through the airport!).

Reviews.Title: “Uber Luxurious.. Simply Awesome”
Reviews.Author: mohitberiwala
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 hours. It is pretty expensive but amazing. Was truly refreshed. Highly recommend it. Simply Luxurious. Would definitely recommend it. The rooms were spanking clean. Bathroom was huge & fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to overnight”
Reviews.Author: Travelswith3kids_10
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with our 3 small children and the room were spacious and very clean, the staff was corteous and polite. I was happy to spend the night and get some sleep before our 14 hour flight the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover hotel option”
Reviews.Author: KATDAV23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here early June. I was met off my flight by a representive from the hotel and escorted through security to reception. Staff were friendly and I found the whole check in procedure very easy when arriving late at night. Stayed for 7 hours and it cost me NZD$242 it does seem expensive for just a night but its well worth it at the end of the day. No hassle of hotel bus transfers etc and you can be asleep within 30 minutes from landing...room was very clean and comfortable bed you can hear some noise from the terminal but it wasnt too bad. Wouldn't hesitate in staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stopover for a few hours”
Reviews.Author: RodandKaren
Reviews.Content: This review is for the Terminal 3 hotel in Dubai. We were met at the plane and taken straight to our room. This was greatly appreciated at 1am with only an 8 hour stopover. the room was superb and the amenities and bed were perfect. the location is exemplary for terminal access and duty free shopping. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: loobieloo1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel when we had to come home unexpectedly and had a 10 hour wait to pick up connecting flight home. Extremely tired when arrived in Dubai and asked at a service desk to see if there was a hotel in the ariport and told there was one behind us. Proceeded to the reservations desk and told the only free rooms were the executive ones which cost us approx £190 for a few hours. Due to the pressure of arranging flights home etc this was well worth the money and the best nights sleep i had had in over a week. Got on the plane home fully refreshed and clean. Due to fly out to Hong Kong in a few weeks and have a ten hour wait in the airport for connecting flight and am about to book the room this time before we travel. We can pick up an earlier connecting flight but that would mean touching down in Bangkok and i would rearther have a good nights sleep and get into their time zone quicker. Although it is exspensive it is well worth the money and at least flying with Emirates I feel pretty safe to get to Hong Kong with our cabin crew striking unlike BA.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Arab_man_travelling
Reviews.Content: Stayed over on a 6 hour rate and it made all the difference. I was met from the plane and taken to the hotel by a very friendly staff member who got me through transfer without having to queue. I was off the plane and in my room within 10 minutes. The check in was simple and straightforward and the staff were extremely helpful. The room was very good, clean, very comfortable bed and complimentary water and fruit. The bathroom was excellent and provided this weary traveller with a refreshing shower in the morning before I left. I was travelling from Riyadh to Newcastle via Dubai. I shall stay over again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Stay but Executive Room rather than standard room”
Reviews.Author: private1_90732
Reviews.Content: Booked direct with hotel and received email confirmation. Met at arrival gate and escorted to hotel.Check in was quick and an improvement over previous stays. Stayed in executive room, more expensive but bigger, room had fax/scanner device and a massage chair. The massage chair was great. Beds were comfortable and provided a great nights sleep for family of 4 (small children). The bathroom also had a bath in addition to the shower (standard rooms I stayed in the past only had shower). Fruit plate is still small compared to how the welcoming fruit plates used to be in the past and for the room rate they can do better. Good selection of toiletries but no razor this time! Front office staff very helpful. Room service was good and food quality excellent but something needs to be done about room service staff having to phone back office to check if its OK for client to charge room service to bill rather than paying cash. This should be done by room service staff prior to delivering food as room phone was used to call back office who then checked with front desk, and back office then called room to confirm to waiter before he would leave food, all this whilst food cools! Not a good practice. Check out was quick, wake up calls accurate. I would stay again if just to save the time commuting arrivals/ departure/ taxi back and forth to hotels external to the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to sleep between flights”
Reviews.Author: MortenM
Reviews.Content: We were flying from Copenhagen over Munich to Mumbai with Lufthansa, "No better way to fly". Unfortunately we cannot say much great about Lufthansa - and cannot really rate whether they are a decent airline or not - as they simply didn't get us on their planes anywhere. We waiting the whole day in Munich airport as our plane from Copenhagen was 20 minutes late so we missed our connecting flights. No assistance from Lufthansa, no food, no leisure or sleep. Got a late flight to Dubai with connection to Mumbai. Arriving 4am danish time we had to sleep for some hours and we choose this hotel. We needed an extra bed. Checkin was fast and efficient, and the bed arrived before we did. It was a nice room - and we slept for 4½ hours before we had to go up to proceed to India. Highly recommended hotel if you need some sleep between planes. The room temperature was fine and the beds great and comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel inside the transit area...”
Reviews.Author: IndiaEuroreisen
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel to stay for the transit passengers, but will be an expensive affair. The reception hall looks amazing. I had a warm welcome at the reception hall. I asked for room to stay for only 6 hours and the best thing is they charge the room according to the number of hours one stay. This came handy for me, The rooms were excellent and I have no words to describe. They have all the qualities of a five star hotel. I would recommend this hotel for all the transit passengers, who has more the four hour waiting time.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very kind hotel and the employees are great and helpful”
Reviews.Author: rudiandjenni
Reviews.Content: I ws traveling and ended up in an embarrasing economic situation with which the staff at this hotel helped me greatly. The behave as gentlemen and are very kind and nice. I believe they are honest and this business will go far because it serves their clients so very well and with dignity. I recommend this hotel to everyone traveling through Dubai and I can not wait to stay at this hotel in the future for every time I am in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Good break during a long flight”
Reviews.Author: Mianel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the airport which makes it very convenient to stay over when there is a long time lag between 2 flights. My travel agent advised me to do so as I had 8 ½ hours between flights. I arrived in terminal 1 in the middle of the night. Although I did not book through the website of the hotel but through a third-party website (which was much cheaper!), a hotel employee was waiting for me with my name on a name plate. He accompanied me to terminal 3 where the hotel is located (10 minutes walk). Check-in was very efficient and I paid my stay at the same time as I wanted to sleep as long as possible the next day. My wake-up call the next morning was perfectly in time. Before you leave the hotel, call the hotel concierge to check the departure time of your flight. My flight turned out to be delayed, so I enjoyed my room a couple of hours longer. The room was spacious with a very good bed and an adequate work desk. There is no outside window. The view from my room was into the business class lounge. The room was completely soundproof: although in the middle of a busy airport I did not experience any noise. The decoration of the room was modern. It was a pity that the carpet was so stained. Wireless internet didn’t work. The wide selection of toiletries was a nice surprise. All in all I liked to stay there. It is very relaxing to have a good sleep in a normal bed traveling from South-east Asia to Western Europe.

Reviews.Title: “serves its purpose well”
Reviews.Author: paganviking
Reviews.Content: the dubai international hotel, located in terminal 1 at dubai international airport, serves its purpose very well. if one has a long layover nothing beats the convenience of the dubai international. clean rooms, adequate service, a comfortable lounge, private business center, an excellent room service menu, and health club round out the top-notch amenities at this facility. two drawbacks: first, the price. anyone who's ever shopped at dubai duty free knows that the only deals to be had are when buying gold. second, the individual rooms lack internet access so guests are forced to use the business center. so, in sum, if you want to eat, drink, and shop at hyper-inflated prices, the dubai international comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Slysaint
Reviews.Content: My mother in law who doesnt speak English was traveling alone for the 1st time in her life. I at the very last minute, (20 mins from her plane landing in Dubai) called the hotel. They arranged to pick my mother in law at the gate and escort her to the hotel. they were even kind enough when my mother in law showed her phone and her out of charge, they arranged for a charger to be sent to her room. finally when the flight got delayed by 2 hours, they were courteous enough to inform her in her language (bengali) that she shouldnt worry and they would come over at the appropriate time and escort her to the gate. yes the room cost me $300+ but, with such service I have to say it was money well spent. The peace of mind that me and my family got because of their service, well it was truly worth it. All this happened today.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT a disappointment ........................ never again.”
Reviews.Author: Salop1
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 7am from Kuwait, having left my hotel there at 1am local time, so badly needed some sleep and refreshment before catching a 14.55 flight back to UK. Thought my idea of checking into a luxury hotel for a few hours was a good idea. WRONG!! It all went well to start with, I was met at the gate and escorted to reception at the hotel. They scanned my passport and I was then whisked off to my luxury room. The aircon was savagely cold and noisy I noted. No matter I just wanted my bed. I was undressed ready for bed and there was a knock at the door. Grabbing the tiny dressing gown I answered the door, they hadn't scanned my passport properly apparently! No matter. I was now awake so ordered breakfast before retiring to bed. The food arrived very promptly, delivered by a waiter who spoke no English. Meanwhile my passport came back. Another distrurbance. As one would expect, I just signed the bill for breakfast and sat down to enjoy my breakfast. Half way through the waiter retuned looking for money. I told him to charge it to my room. Another disturbance. Then reception rang about the breakfast bill. Some sort of conversation took place over some mysterious "advantage card". God knows what it was all about. At that hour after a sleepless night I was past caring. By now I was frozen, but the aircon controls were beyonf me. No matter and engineer came along and turned off some switches behind the mirror. Isnt technology wonderful! I then went to bed and after an hour was woken by a hammer drill. Within ten minutes a second hammer drill started. I literally could not hear myself think. I rang reception, no reaction. So after another ten minutes, exhausted, I dressed again and headed for reception, tired and angry. I checked out and paid for four hours misery, refusing to pay the remaining 3 hours booked.
